info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 7:07PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Catawba, Alexander, northwestern Iredell, southeastern Caldwell and eastern Burke Counties through 745 PM EST... At 707 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hickory, or near Lake Hickory, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Newton, Taylorsville, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Granite Falls, Bethlehem, Icard and Hildebran. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for western North Carolina.
